intro: Hieracium prenanthoides subsp. prenanthoides, commonly known as the lesser spearthistle, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its erect, sparsely hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate to ovate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flower heads that are typically clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. The subspecies is distinguished by its relatively smaller size and more compact growth form compared to other Hieracium species.
